bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 19, 1947

div1.p: Siler informs Hench of the Walter Reed Memorial Association meeting date and site. Sawyer would like to contact Hench.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 19, 1947
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 19, 1947
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayflower
Washington D.C.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have your note of November 7th and as I am unable
to get in touch with you before your arrival in Washington (for
lack of a definite address) I am leaving this note at the Mayflower
Hotel to be turned over to you on arrival there.

The annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Asso-
ciation will be held in the Board Room of the American Security and
Trust Company, 15th Street and Pennsylvania Avenue, Northwest, at
10:30 A.M. on November 25. As you inferred, this is the same build-
ing in which the meeting was held last year.

We shall look forward with very great pleasure to seeing
you then. I am asking Dr. Sawyer to come to our meeting as a guest
as he is particularly anxious to get in touch with you immediately.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Colonel, U.S.A., Retired
Secretary
Walter Reed Memorial Assn (Home telephone - Emerson 8943)
